content:
Thunderbird has saved the password for IMAP on my email account, but not the password for SMTP, so I have to enter the password manually each time I send an email.

Is there any way I can save the password for SMTP as I am unable to find one in Thunderbird.

Thanks

title: How can I set a System tray Icon and show total unread email counts in the system tray icon ?
content: I am on Linux Mint 21.1 Cinnamon and I have been using Birdtray as Thunderbird system tray notification. But from 102 version Birdtray can't read incoming unread email, can't show notifications and can't shows unread counts. So, can I set a System tray Icon and show total unread email counts in the system tray icon for Thunderbird email ? Plz advise me if anyone has a solution. Thanks in advance.

content: I am on Linux mint 21.1 Cinnamon and using Thunderbird 102.11.0. I saw the current version of Thunderbird on their official website is 102.11.2. I didn't get the update yet. So, how can I get the update automatically to use the latest version of Thunderbird on Linux Mint 21.1 Cinnamon ? Thanks in advance and awaiting to have a good feedback.

title: richiesta aiuto per archiviazione e mail
content: Buongiorno, lavoro in uno studio legale e i miei account di posta elettronico sono su server Aruba ma lo spazio non basta e per via del mio lavoro devo archiviare tutte le mail dello studio sia in entrata che in uscita. sul pc ho trovato configurato thunderbird e mi trovo benissimo, ho archiviato tutte le migliaia di e mail (in entrata, perché in uscita non sono sincronizzate) ma non capisco che differenza ci sia tra "archivio" e "cartelle locali" ed inoltre quando provo a scaricarle, forse per via della quantità, mi si blocca il download a metà. C'è qualcuno che gentilmente potrebbe seguirmi in questi passaggi? si tratta di e mail che è meglio che non non si cancellino. Grazie mille a tutti. Michela
creator: cristina18

title: Thunderbird email folder missing!
content: My previous email provider (Spectrum) disconnected my email account because they don't provide service at my new address. Now the entire folder and subfolders for the Spectrum account are missing from Thunderbird. Where can I find the email folder on my hard drive and reconnect it to Thunderbird? Thank you.

title: Calendar becomes unusable when setting an end date for an appointment
content: I've used the Thunderbird calendar for appointments for years and today had my first issue when I tried to set an end date for a recurring appointment. Once I edited the appointment (all occurrences) all appointments in my calendar were covered by a colored grid and were unreadable. Fortunately I had backed up the calendar a couple of days ago so I was able to restore the calendar by restoring the calendar data file from my backup. I attempted to set an end date for the appointment again but the calendar became corrupted once again. I am attaching a screenshot of what the calendar looked like after trying to set an end date for an appointment. I assume this is a recently introduced bug in the program, if not is there another workaround besides retrieving a backup for the calendar data file?
creator: thom13

My "Copied and Folders" settings for sent mail are currently set for "Other" and "Sent Items on [+my email address]". Does anyone know how to eliminate this weird duplication? Thanks.

title: "Could Not Detect Login Form"-- I lost the entire "INBOX"  after automatic download/install of v. 102.11.2.
content:
I lost the entire "INBOX" (and other sub-catagories) after an automatic download/install of Thunderbird v. 102.11.2

There is now an empty INBOX and .msf associated with Thunderbird appearing in the directory, however, the INBOX still does not appear in the T-Bird program screen (see attached screenshot).

Although I am not panicking, there is a message in the bar at the bottom left hand corner of the T-Bird form stating " "Could Not Detect Login Form".

This now beyond my amateur troubleshooting capabilities. Any suggestions regarding rebuilding or location a Login Form? Thanks in advance for the assist!
creator: reedh1

title: Togliere la scritta "Auto:" dall'oggetto delle email automatiche
content:
Salve, ho notato che Thunderbird antepone all'oggetto dell'email automatica la scritta "Auto:". Avrei bisogno di eliminare questa scritta e che dunque l'email venga inviata con l'oggetto impostato nel modello. Sarebbe possibile?

Nell'immagine 1 ho creato un filtro che in poche parole dice a Thunderbird: quando in posta in arrivo attivo l'etichetta "Completato" tu ogni 10 minuti rispondi con il modello: "Quante stelle darebbe..."

Nell'immagine 2 mostro il modello che ho creato e dunque con questa email Thunderbird dovrà rispondere automaticamente al mittente.

Nell'immagine 3 infine mostro il problema ovvero nella cartella di posta inviata troviamo due email: la prima, quella del 01/06/2023, 23:57 è stata inviata automaticamente da Thunderbird che ha applicato il filtro e ha anteposto la scritto "Auto:" dinanzi all'oggetto. La seconda email invece, quella del 01/06/2023 delle ore 23:49 è stata inviata manualmente e difatti l'oggetto è così come impostato nel modello. Io vorrei togliere quella scritta "Auto:" che Thunderbird antepone all'oggetto perché l'invito alla recensione, così come viene spedito in automatico da Thunderbird, non viene recepito da Trustpilot e dunque non programmato in inviti automatici dello stesso Trustpilot, qui entriamo nel difficile (per me) ma è importante eliminare quella scritta "Auto:". Sarebbe possibile?

Grazie a tutti per l'attenzione
creator: realfabry

title: não estou recebendo email apos dia 1 de junho quando o programa atualizou
content: como fazer para entrar com a senha principal
creator: jorgejr164

title: new mail alert
content:
when i get a new email it triggers the generic notification event and not the new mail event so if i want to get a quack when i get a new email i have to get a quack for all generic notifications using the system notifications. Now if i use the thunderbird notifications(which i actually like better) i can change the sound and all but i get the notification when playing video and games, even in game mode.....it blocks the system notifications.

BTW loving the new beta thunderbird right now especially the card view for messages

Thank you for your time Rich
creator: kashmir0069

title: Security Exceptions in TB - three exception windows pop up
content:
Back in April three Security Exception windows started popping up in TB 102.11.2 (not sending mail or retrieving mail) and if I view it, the certificate shows an expired date. The port being accessed is 2080. 

  host2016.hostmonster.com:2080

I don't seem to be missing any mail and they just popup on their own at times (something in the background?). I use IMAP settings and Eset as my AV. It doesn't happen to my wife's TB install and she uses the same email server and AV. It happens on all four computers where I have my account being accessed by TB.

I have scanned the PC with ESET NOD32 and Malwarebytes and neither reports viruses. I don't want to override the warning so I have to close the three windows over and over and over and I am going mad....

I turned off the eset feature that says to ask if a SSL exception is reported. I set it to block, not ask, and rebooted. The popups continue and the email provider support says their certificates are up to date.

Anyone know why port 2080? Could it be related to something other than inbound and outbound email that TB is trying to access?
creator: sub8

title: Thunderbird Mail Passoword Authentication failed
content: I use Thunderbird mail for Godaddy hosted domain with workspace mail. I've been using it for years with no problem. I have not changed my password. Yesterday, I could no longer receive or send email because my password cannot be authenticated. My login to pop.secureserver.net keeps failing. My Thunderbird is up to date.
